fields.description:
I had a multicluster system on 3.2.2.  I wanted to setup HA for CLC so I added CLC onto the second cluster box.  After installation the second CLC cannot come up successfully because the DB cannot properly sync.

topo before adding CLC
\[UI CLC WS SC00 CC00\]
\[SC01 CC01\]
\[NC00\]
\[NC01\]

topo after adding secondary CLC:
\[UI CLC WS SC00 CC00\]
\[SC01 CC01 CLC\]
\[NC00\]
\[NC01\]

Some of the error form cloud-output.log
{code}

fields.summary: Issue adding secondary CLC after upgrade

comments.body:
This was fixed by dropping the following tables from the orignal CLC's eucalyptus_storage db:
aoemetainfo, aoevolumeinfo,storage_stats_info
[~tony], [~viglesias], can you help out with some content for docs for the RN?  I'm not clear on the workaround.

This isn't something that we'd ask the admin to do.  This sounds like something that Customer Support or Engineering would have to do, so I'm not sure this even makes sense to add to our docs.  Or am I missing something?

[~awithrow] if the cloud admin wants to configure an HA CLC and they have upgraded they will have to apply this workaround due to the bug. It should be a KB article or something. It doesn't necessarily belong in the install guide.  However, until it is fixed a link in the install guide HA setup part to the article/workaround should be there.

[~awithrow]

This is related to adding a CLC post facto (ie not in the initial install process).

Thank for the info guys.   I get that this is add a CLC after an upgrade, but regardless this sounds like DB surgery.  I would recommend that we add a note in the Release Notes with a suggestion to contact Support for the workaround.  Support can created a KB article and publish it if they are comfortable with admins doing this to a running cloud.
When the KB article is written the release notes ought to mention it anyway so people without subscriptions can find it.

KB article released - https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/articles/1175134-issues-moving-to-ha-clc-from-non-ha-setup

[~awithrow], let us know if there are any other actions on this.

Thanks.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.1605.20131009git9b2f1867.el6

Took a 3.3.2 setup (topo below) performed upgrade to 3.4 then successfully added a secondary CLC.

topo before adding CLC
\[UI CLC WS SC00 CC00\]
\[SC01 CC01\]
\[NC00\]
\[NC01\]

topo after adding secondary CLC:
\[UI CLC WS SC00 CC00\]
\[SC01 CC01 CLC\]
\[NC00\]
\[NC01\]
